pull.title: test: Avoid hard time.sleep(1) in feature_init.py
pull.body:
Using a hard-coded `time.sleep` in the tests is usually confusing and brittle. For example, the one in `break_wait_test`:

* Is confusing, because it does not explain why it is needed.
* On fast hardware will just lead to a useless delay.
* On slow hardware may lead to an intermittent, and confusing test failure.

Fix all issues by replacing it with the proper condition to wait on.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

events.message: test: Avoid hard time.sleep(1) in feature_init.py

events.body:
tACK fa727e3

Seems like an esoteric change but I will have it because I like it.

utACK fa727e3ec984106371eeedb34d7bbbbc3dcce4ff

Thanks, this is easier to read than before: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34137#discussion_r2641818893

It's also an improvement over `sleep(1)`, because the code specifically says what it's waiting for.

tACK fa727e3ec984106371eeedb34d7bbbbc3dcce4ff

PR removes arbitrary sleep(1) for a "readiness" check, this improves reliability of test. 
(on my machine there is a 1 sec reduction on test duration; Master: `Feature-init.py (15s)` - this PR `Feature-init.py (14s)` )

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -272,7 +271,14 @@ def break_wait_test(self):
             # returns early it will return the current block height.
             self.log.debug(f"Calling waitforblockheight with {self.rpc_timeout} sec RPC timeout")
comments.body: nit: I think the comment should say "with 2x RPC timeout (2x {self.rpc_timeout} sec)"

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -272,7 +271,14 @@ def break_wait_test(self):
             # returns early it will return the current block height.
             self.log.debug(f"Calling waitforblockheight with {self.rpc_timeout} sec RPC timeout")
             fut = ex.submit(node.waitforblockheight, height=current_height+1, timeout=self.rpc_timeout*1000*2)
-            time.sleep(1)
+
+            def waitforblockheight_active():
comments.body:
So IIUC this checks if there's any active commands. If not, it throws `KeyError` so the wait ends. If there is one, it ensure the first running command is `waitforblockheight` and then ends the wait.

A bit hard to follow. Maybe instead check whether any of the `active_commands` is `waitforblockheight`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -272,7 +271,14 @@ def break_wait_test(self):
             # returns early it will return the current block height.
             self.log.debug(f"Calling waitforblockheight with {self.rpc_timeout} sec RPC timeout")
             fut = ex.submit(node.waitforblockheight, height=current_height+1, timeout=self.rpc_timeout*1000*2)
-            time.sleep(1)
+
+            def waitforblockheight_active():
comments.body:
> So IIUC this checks if there's any active commands. If not, it throws `KeyError` so the wait ends.

No it does not. It waits until the condition is true.

In any case, I am happy to push any diff or commit, if someone writes one.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -272,7 +271,14 @@ def break_wait_test(self):
             # returns early it will return the current block height.
             self.log.debug(f"Calling waitforblockheight with {self.rpc_timeout} sec RPC timeout")
comments.body:
No? The rpc timeout is half in reality, since it is never re-set after the init loop, which sets it to half.

edit: Also, this seems unrelated to the changes here. I am not touching this line.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -272,7 +271,14 @@ def break_wait_test(self):
             # returns early it will return the current block height.
             self.log.debug(f"Calling waitforblockheight with {self.rpc_timeout} sec RPC timeout")
             fut = ex.submit(node.waitforblockheight, height=current_height+1, timeout=self.rpc_timeout*1000*2)
-            time.sleep(1)
+
+            def waitforblockheight_active():
comments.body:
> In any case, I am happy to push any diff or commit, if someone writes one.

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/feature_init.py b/test/functional/feature_init.py
index eb45340da7..56f3e61d21 100755
--- a/test/functional/feature_init.py
+++ b/test/functional/feature_init.py
@@ -274,7 +274,7 @@ class InitTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
 
             def waitforblockheight_active():
                 try:
-                    return node.cli.getrpcinfo()["active_commands"][0]["method"] == "waitforblockheight"
+                    return any(active_command["method"] == "waitforblockheight" for active_command in node.cli.getrpcinfo()["active_commands"])
                 except KeyError:
                     return False
```
